MAN.TITLE: fprintf
MAN.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: Emulator of C language fprintf function

PARAM_DESCRIPTION.SP: : a Scilab string. Specifies a character string combining literal characters with conversion specifications.
: Specifies the data to be converted according to the format parameter.
: a Scilab string specifying a file name or a logical unit number (see file)

DESCRIPTION.P: Obsolete function, use preferabily the mfprintf function which is much more compatible with the C fprintf functionalities.
The fprintf function converts, formats, and writes its value parameters, under control of the format parameter, to the file specified by its file parameter.
The format parameter is a character string that contains two types of objects:

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: Literal characters
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : which are copied to the output stream.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: Conversion specifications
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : each of which causes zero or more items to be fetched from the value parameter list. see printf_conversion for details

DESCRIPTION.P: If any values remain after the entire format has been processed, they are ignored.

MAN.EXAMPLE: u=file('open','results','unknown') //open the result file t=0:0.1:2*%pi; for tk=t fprintf(u,'time = %6.3f value = %6.3f',tk,sin(tk)) // write a line end file('close',u) //close the result file
